source.ad934de1:
import os
import pandas as pd
import plotly.graph_objects as go
from plotly.subplots import make_subplots
from plotly.offline import iplot 

def load_csv(base_dir,file_name):
    """Loads a CSV file into a Pandas DataFrame"""
    file_path = os.path.join(base_dir,file_name)
    df = pd.read_csv(file_path,low_memory=False)
    return df

questions_with_response_counts = load_csv('/kaggle/input/response-counts-for-the-2020-kaggle-ds-ml-survey/'
                                        ,'questions_with_response_counts.csv')
source.b2b8ab1c:
trace1 = go.Scatter(
                    x = questions_with_response_counts['Question'],
                    y = questions_with_response_counts['# of Respondents'],
                    mode = "lines+markers",
                    name = "gettingStarted",
                    marker = dict(color = 'blue'),)
data = [trace1]
layout = dict(title = 'Number of Responses per Question',
              yaxis= dict(title= '# of Responses',ticklen= 5,zeroline= False),
              legend=dict(orientation= "h",x=0, y= 1.13),width=800,height=400,
              annotations=[
         dict(
                x=18.5,
                y=14500,
                xref='x',
                yref='y',
                text='Employed to Code',
                showarrow=True,
                arrowhead=1,
                ax=0,
                ay=-40),
         dict(
                x=16,
                y=17000,
                xref='x',
                yref='y',
                text='Use a specific method',
                showarrow=True,
                arrowhead=1,
                ax=0,
                ay=-40),
         dict(
                x=31,
                y=6000,
                xref='x',
                yref='y',
                text='Use a specific product',
                showarrow=True,
                arrowhead=1,
                ax=0,
                ay=-40),
         dict(
                x=40,
                y=15000,
                xref='x',
                yref='y',
                text='Students only',
                showarrow=True,
                arrowhead=1,
                ax=0,
                ay=-40),
         dict(
                x=25,
                y=9500,
                xref='x',
                yref='y',
                text='Spend Money on ML Products',
                showarrow=True,
                arrowhead=1,
                ax=0,
                ay=-40)                
            ]
             )
fig = dict(data = data, layout = layout)
iplot(fig)

source.0aae7095: Respondents with the most experience were asked the most questions.  For additional context, including an explanation for why some questions have more responses than other questions, please refer to https://www.kaggle.com/c/kaggle-survey-2020.
